data.title: Kunlavut eyes SF spot after tough loss
data.description: Kunlavut Vitidsarn will battle Jonatan Christie in the final Group B match on Friday with a place in the men

data.title: Supachok confident in Thailand chances
data.description: Thailand star Supachok Sarachat believes the team can cope with the pressure and expectations at the Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024.

data.title: Fifa confirms Saudi Arabia as 2034 World Cup host
data.description: Fifa on Wednesday confirmed that Saudi Arabia will host the 2034 World Cup, underlining the Gulf kingdom

data.title: Kunlavut fast off the blocks
data.description: Kunlavut Vitidsarn got off to a strong start at the season-ending BWF World Tour Finals in Hangzhou, China, on Wednesday.

data.title: Tickets on sale in January
data.description: Tickets for the season-opening PT Grand Prix of Thailand 2025 will officially go on sale on Jan 9 next year.

data.title: Ekanit returns as Thais aim for victory
data.description: Talented midfielder Ekanit Panya on Wednesday joined the Thai national team training camp for the ongoing Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024.

data.title: Shoulder tilt is the key to powerful swings
data.description: When at the top of our swings our shoulders should be tilted from the top, not level as l see sometimes. Most golfers want to hit the ball long, and tilting your shoulders as we turn them will help tremendously. Shift your hips towards your target on your downswing so that your tailbone finishes up closer to the target. But your head should not get closer to the target or go too far over the back foot.

data.title: Benjamin out for two weeks after Timor win
data.description: Thailand midfielder Benjamin Davis will be out of action for two weeks after picking up an ankle injury during the War Elephants

data.title: Supanida faces a giant task against An
data.description: Thai trio Supanida Katethong, Busanan Ongbamrungphan and Kunlavut Vitidsarn will begin their campaign at the BWF World Tour Finals 2024 today in Hangzhou, China.

data.title: War Elephants in Group D for Asian Cup qualifiers
data.description: Thailand were drawn in Group D with Turkmenistan, Taiwan and Sri Lanka for the 2027  AFC Asian Cup , which will be staged in Saudi Arabia.

data.title: Goals galore as Thailand rout Timor
data.description: Reigning champions Thailand, aiming to win an unprecedented third title in a row, made their intentions clear on Sunday night when they began their Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024 campaign with a 10-0 hammering of Timor Leste at Hang Day Stadium.

data.title: ONE Championship’s Thongpoon out to avenge El Jamari loss after ‘unlocking’ old self at Fight Night 26
data.description: Thongpoon PK Saenchai has called for a rematch with Zakaria El Jamari after getting back in the ONE Championship win column on Saturday in Bangkok.

data.title: ONE Championship’s Qatar return set to see Shamil Gasanov fight Martin Nguyen
data.description: Shamil Gasanov is set to fight former ONE Championship featherweight MMA champion Martin Nguyen in Qatar on February 20.

data.title: Ito's late strike rekindles Nakhon Pathom's hopes
data.description: Taku Ito scored the winning goal as hosts Nakhon Pathom United picked up three points after a 2-1 victory in their Thai League 1 game against former champions Chiang Rai United on Saturday night.

data.title: Confident Thais eye win in Asean football opener
data.description: Thailand may be missing many of their key players but they remain confident of kicking off the defence of their Asean championship title with a victory over Timor Leste at Hang Day Stadium in Vietnam Sunday night.

data.title: Confident Thais eye win in opener
data.description: Thailand may be missing many of their key players but they remain confident of kicking off the defence of their Asean championship title with a victory over Timor Leste at Hang Day Stadium in Vietnam Sunday night.

data.title: ONE Championship: Christian Lee eyes return in March after eye poke ends big return early
data.description: Christian Lee’s long-awaited ONE Championship comeback ended in anticlimactic fashion after an unintentional eye poke left title challenger Alibeg Rasulov unable to continue in Saturday’s ONE Fight Night 26 main event in Bangkok.

data.title: Kirins, Port make ACL 2 2nd round
data.description: Muang Thong United secured their place in the knockout stage after a dramatic 1-0 victory over Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors in the AFC Champions League Two at Rajamangala Stadium on Thursday night.

data.title: Midweek goal fest: 35 strikes, thrilling ties
data.description: For many years there has been something special about matches between Newcastle and Liverpool that guarantees entertainment. Fans were not disappointed in the midweek clash at St James

data.title: Thais leave for Vietnam to begin Asean title defence
data.description: Champions Thailand left for Vietnam on Friday morning to kick off their title defence of the Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024.

data.title: ONE Championship: Petchtanong denies ‘running away’ after hospital visit, with Nabil fight cancelled
data.description: Petchtanong Petchfergus’ kickboxing bout with Nabil Anane has been removed from Saturday’s ONE Fight Night 26 card at Lumpinee Stadium in Bangkok.

data.title: HM Queen to compete in sailing
data.description: Her Majesty the Queen will join Thailand

data.title: ONE Championship: three fighters miss weight for Fight Night 26 card in Bangkok
data.description: Three fighters missed weight for ONE Fight night 26 at Thursday’s official ONE Championship weigh-ins and hydration tests in Bangkok.

data.title: Angels seal top spot with thrilling Nam Dinh victory
data.description: Bangkok United finished as Group G winners after they defeated Nam Dinh FC 3-2 in the AFC Champions League Two at Thammasat Stadium on Wednesday night.
